caption.p: Anti-inflammatory activities of the hydro-ethanolic extract of Nymphaea lotus leaves (NLE, 100, 250 and 500 mg/kg, p.o.) and hydrocortisone (4 mg/kg) on the rate of sedimentation of erythrocyte (ESR) from blood samples of ovalbumin (OVA)-sensitized SD rats. Data are mean value ± standard error on the mean (SEM), (n = 5). *p < 0.05, **p < 0.01 when compared to the negative control group, using one-way ANOVA followed by a Dunnett’s Multiple Comparison Test
